Key Arguments: The legislation violates Australians' constitutional right to freedom of speech.
ACMA should not have the authority to determine what constitutes the truth.
Truth is subjective and can vary based on perspective, such as in matters of religion.
Truth can change over time as new information becomes available.
Main Themes: Historical changes in understanding of truth
Notable Quotes: This proposed ‘combatting misinformation and disinformation bill’ would violate Australian’s constitutional right to freedom of speech.
One person’s ‘truth’ is radically different to another person’s truth when it comes to religion.
‘The truth’ is always multi-faceted depending on one’s perspective so it should never be narrowed to one source.
